item.description: Callahan State Park is a 820-acre day use area located in Northwest Framingham. Callahan has seven miles of marked trails. Within the park are nearly 100 acres of open fields, 70 acres of which are currently under an agricultural lease. Note: There are 3 parking lots for this venue. We will meet at the South Entrance on Millwood Street. DIRECTIONS: From East or west: Rt. 9 west to Rt. 30 exit, right at first set of lights to Edgell Road to Belknap Road (left), right onto Millwood Street to entrance on left across from golf course. Afterwards, we'll visit Martha's home to evaluate her habitat and discuss improvements for wildlife. WEBSITE LINK: http://www.mass.gov/dcr/parks/northeast/call.htm
item.name: Callahan State Park (and Martha's backyard....plus frontyard too).
